column4: anyone know how to get apt to remove, or install, a package when its complaining about not being able to find a package ?
you cannot remove something not being installed
well thats the problem, its in some kind of quasi installed state
i want to A) finish installing B) remove it
no ideas then ?
not really, try "sudo aptitude -f install"
yea done did that
apt wont do anything till this package dependancy is resolved, the problem is THATS the package im installing
HandBrake-svn3154-Ubuntu_GUI_x86_64.deb had a depanacy, broke install, NOW apt says its handbreak-gtk
sudo dpkg -P package
i can not get apt to install <any other packages> such as <deselect> till this is fixed
ah one sec
ffs
same error as apt-get
http://pastebin.org/121264
there are some "force" options for dpkg (man dpkg), maybe they help. but it's always dangerous...
at this point idgaf lol, this is anoying
and i did try aptgets force, same issue
can you manually download that .deb and reinstall it with dpkg?
or take it from /var/cache/apt/archives
i HAVE that .deb, the probelm is the .deb is call ed one thing, while apt calls it something else (yes, it is the smae one cause in aptitude it has the svn version correct)
